artist: Painter: After Jacopo Tintoretto; Engraver: Richard Earlom; Publisher: John Boydell
description: Eneas carrying Anchyses on his right shoulder; statue of house god under left arm; Ascanius walking at right side holding a torch; Troy burning in distance
inscription:
Signature, Title, Date, and Inscription

below image in black: Tintoreto pinxit    R. Earlom delin. & Sculpsit / ENEAS CARRYING HIS FATHER ANCHYSES FROM THE RUINS OF TROY / From the Original Picture Painted by Jacopo Robusti, commonly called Tentoretto / In the Collection of his Grace the Duke of Devonshire / size of Picture 1F 0I by 1F 4I in height / Vol II No. 19  John Boydell excudit London 1767 (coat of arms in center of inscription) | on sheet verso in pencil: 2-277
title: Eneas Carrying His Father Anchyses From the Ruins of Troy
